str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Greatly terrified, horrified. From ek and phobos; frightened out of one's wits: sore afraid, exceedingly fear.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Pluperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.
